name: Malaysia
introduction: During the late 18th and 19th centuries Great Britain established colonies and protectorates in the area of current Malaysia; these were occupied by Japan from 1942 to 1945. In 1948 the British-ruled territories on the Malay Peninsula except Singapore formed the Federation of Malaya which became independent in 1957. Malaysia was formed in 1963 when the former British colonies of Singapore as well as Sabah and Sarawak on the northern coast of Borneo joined the Federation. The first several years of the country's independence were marred by a communist insurgency Indonesian confrontation with Malaysia Philippine claims to Sabah and Singapore's withdrawal in 1965. During the 22-year term of Prime Minister MAHATHIR bin Mohamad (1981-2003) Malaysia was successful in diversifying its economy from dependence on exports of raw materials to the development of manufacturing services and tourism. Prime Minister Mohamed NAJIB bin Abdul Razak (in office since April 2009) has continued these pro-business policies.
overview: 'Malaysia is a Southeast Asian country occupying parts of the Malay Peninsula and the island of Borneo. It''s known for its beaches rainforests and mix of Malay Chinese Indian and European cultural influences. The capital Kuala Lumpur is home to colonial buildings busy shopping districts such as Bukit Bintang and skyscrapers such as the iconic 451m-tall Petronas Twin Towers.'

languages.name: Abai Sungai
languages.area: Lower reaches of Kinabatangan River.

languages.name: Ambonese Malay
languages.area: Central Maluku, Ambon, Haruku, Nusa Laut, Saparua Islands, along the coastal areas of Seram, and south Maluku. Also in Netherlands, United States.

languages.name: Achinese
languages.area: Aceh Province (north tip of Sumatra), coastal areas.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Balinese
languages.area: Island of Bali, north Nusa Penida, west Lombok Islands, and east Java, South Sulawesi.

languages.name: Bonggi
languages.area: Kudat District, Banggi Island. 15 villages.

languages.name: West Coast Bajau
languages.area: West coast of Sabah, Kuala Penyu to Kudat, north, some east areas.

languages.name: Belait
languages.area: Scattered in Belait District; Tutong District in Kampung Kiudang. Also in Malaysia (Sarawak).

languages.name: Bengali

languages.name: Banjar

languages.name: Bukitan

languages.name: Bookan

languages.name: Bintulu

languages.name: Brunei Bisaya

languages.name: Sabah Bisaya

languages.name: Biatah Bidayuh

languages.name: Batak Mandailing

languages.name: Batek

languages.name: Buginese
languages.area: Western coast of southeast Sulawesi in Kolaka, Wundulako, Rumbia, and Poleang districts. Also in major towns of Sulawesi. Large enclaves also in other provinces of Sulawesi, Kalimantan, Maluku, Papua, and Sumatra; coastal swamp areas such as Bulukumba, Luwu, Polewali in Polmas, Pasangkayu in Mamuju districts. Also in Malaysia (Sabah).

languages.name: Malaccan Creole Malay

languages.name: Min Dong Chinese

languages.name: Western Cham

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese

Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Hakka Chinese
languages.autonym: 客家話 / 客家话 Hak-kâ-fa
languages.area: Widespread with other dialects. Eastern and northeastern Guangdong greatest concentration; also in Fujian, Jiangxi, Guangxi, Hunan, and Sichuan. Also in Brunei, Canada, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, New Zealand, Panama, Singapore, South Africa, Suriname, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States.

Also in Bangladesh, Belize, Bhutan, Botswana, Canada, Djibouti, Germany, Kenya, Nepal, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Yemen, Zambia.

Xiamen in south Fujian, Jiangxi, and Taiwan; Hainan in Hainan; Leizhou on Leizhou peninsula of southwest Guangdong; Chao-Shan in far east corner of Guangdong in Chaozhou-Shantou area; Longdu is a dialect island around Zhongshan City and Shaxi in Guangdong south of Guangzhou; Zhenan Min in southeast Zhejiang Province around Pingyang and Cangnan and on Zhoushan archipelago of northeast Zhejiang. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United States.

Northern Sama on Luzon at White Beach near Subic Bay; Lutangan in western Mindanao, Olutangga Island. Also in Malaysia (Sabah).

languages.name: Vietnamese
